intro: Tanarius boutonioides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, velvety flowers. The plant typically has dark green, velvety leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Tanarius boutonioides thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers warm, humid conditions.
